comments: Requires concurrent registration in BIOL 234 or BIOL 240. Class meets 6 times during the term, dates TBD.
prerequisites: Prerequisite: Concurrent registration in Biology 234 or 240 required
summary: CRISPR is a new genetic engineering technology that, according to a recent article in Gizmodo, "allows scientists to edit genomes with unprecedented precision, efficiency, and flexibility." While offering the promise of revolutionary medical breakthroughs, CRISPR also raises all kinds of knotty ethical issues. The purpose of this discussion course is to understand how CRISPR works and to get to the bottom of some of the ethical issues.
title: CRISPR and You
